lexicalItems.sourceContext: Palm oil is an edible oil derived from the fruit of...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Oil that is suitable for eating; cooking oil.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Dầu ăn (dầu có thể ăn được).

phase3Production.content: Not all mushrooms are edible; some are highly poisonous.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...edible oil derived from the fruit of the African oil palm tree...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Được 'derived from' (lấy từ, bắt nguồn từ) quả của cây cọ dầu.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To get something from something else; to originate from.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bắt nguồn từ, được lấy từ.

phase3Production.content: This medicine is derived from a rare tropical plant.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and is currently the most consumed vegetable oil in the world.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Dầu thực vật' (vegetable oil) được 'consumed' (tiêu thụ) 'nhiều nhất' (most).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Vegetable oil that is eaten or used by people.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Dầu thực vật được tiêu thụ.

phase3Production.content: Rice is the most consumed grain in many parts of Asia.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: It's almost certainly in the soap we wash with...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Very probably; with very little doubt.

phase3Production.content: If you don't study, you will almost certainly fail the exam.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Why is palm oil so attractive for manufacturers?

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Appealing or desirable to companies that produce goods in large quantities.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Hấp dẫn đối với các nhà sản xuất.

phase3Production.content: The low tax rate makes this country attractive for manufacturers.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Primarily because its unique properties – such as remaining solid...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Special characteristics or qualities that make something different from all others.

phase3Production.content: Water has unique properties, such as expanding when it freezes.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...such as remaining solid at room temperature...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Remaining' (duy trì) 'solid' (trạng thái rắn) 'at room temperature' (ở nhiệt độ phòng).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Staying in a firm or hard state (not liquid) at a normal indoor temperature.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Giữ thể rắn ở nhiệt độ phòng.

phase3Production.content: Unlike butter, margarine does not always remaining solid at room temperature.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...make it an ideal ingredient for long-term preservation...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A perfect component to include when making something.

phase3Production.content: Flour is the ideal ingredient for making bread.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...for long-term preservation, allowing many packaged foods...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The act of keeping something (like food) in good condition for a long period of time.

phase3Production.content: Canning is a popular method for the long-term preservation of fruits.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...allowing many packaged foods on supermarket shelves...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Food that is sold in bags, boxes, cans, or other containers.

phase3Production.content: Packaged foods often contain high levels of salt and preservatives.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to have 'best before' dates of months, even years, into the future.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Hạn 'sử dụng tốt nhất trước' (hạn sử dụng).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The date printed on food packaging that indicates the time by which the food is at its best quality (not necessarily unsafe after).

phase3Production.content: You can still eat yogurt after its 'best before' date, but it might not taste as good.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Many farmers have seized the opportunity to maximise the planting...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To quickly and eagerly take advantage of a chance to do something.

phase3Production.content: When the company offered her a promotion, she seized the opportunity.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to maximise the planting of oil palm trees.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Để 'maximise' (tối đa hóa) 'the planting' (việc trồng trọt).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To increase the amount of planting (of oil palm trees) as much as possible.

phase3Production.content: The farmer used new techniques to maximise the planting of his crops.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the global land area devoted to growing oil palm trees grew from...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Diện tích đất toàn cầu' (global land area) 'dành cho' (devoted to) việc trồng cọ.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The total amount of land across the world that is used specifically for a particular purpose (e.g., growing crops).
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Diện tích đất toàn cầu dành cho (việc gì).

phase3Production.content: The global land area devoted to agriculture has increased significantly.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...now accounting for around ten percent of total cropland...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To form a particular amount or part of something; to make up.

phase3Production.content: Students account for nearly 80% of our customer base.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...ten percent of total cropland in the entire world.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The total amount of land that is used for growing crops.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Tổng diện tích đất trồng trọt/canh tác.

phase3Production.content: This region contains most of the country's total cropland.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...a figure looking likely to double or even triple...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'figure' (con số) có khả năng tăng gấp đôi.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A number representing a particular amount, especially one that is officially recorded.

phase3Production.content: The unemployment figure has dropped for the third consecutive month.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: by the middle of the century
lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to double or even triple by the middle of the century.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Around the year 2050 (if referring to the 21st century).

phase3Production.content: Some experts predict that the global population will peak by the middle of the century.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: However, there are multiple reasons why conservationists cite...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các 'nhà bảo tồn' (conservationists) 'cite' (trích dẫn) lý do.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: People who work to protect animals, plants, and natural resources from being damaged or destroyed.

phase3Production.content: Conservationists are working to save the endangered rhino species.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...cite the rapid spread of oil palm plantations as a major concern.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A very fast increase in the number or size of something, covering a larger area.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự lan rộng/phát tán nhanh chóng.

phase3Production.content: The rapid spread of the fire forced residents to evacuate.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...spread of oil palm plantations as a major concern.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Large farms or estates in a tropical country where oil palm trees are grown commercially.

phase3Production.content: Vast areas of rainforest have been cleared to make way for oil palm plantations.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...as a major concern.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A significant or very important worry.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một mối lo ngại/quan ngại lớn/chính.

phase3Production.content: Pollution in the city has become a major concern for its residents.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: There are countless news stories of deforestation...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Too many to be counted; very numerous.

phase3Production.content: There are countless stars in the night sky.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...countless news stories of deforestation, habitat destruction...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The act of cutting down or clearing all the trees from an area (a forest).
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Nạn phá rừng, sự phá rừng.

phase3Production.content: Deforestation is a primary cause of climate change and loss of biodiversity.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...deforestation, habitat destruction and dwindling species populations...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The process by which a natural habitat is damaged or destroyed so that it can no longer support the species that live there.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự phá hủy môi trường sống.

phase3Production.content: The new dam caused massive habitat destruction upstream.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and dwindling species populations, all as a direct result of...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các 'quần thể loài' (species populations) 'đang suy giảm' (dwindling).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The numbers of a species that are gradually becoming smaller or fewer.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các quần thể loài đang suy giảm/teo tóp.

phase3Production.content: Conservationists are concerned about the dwindling species populations of polar bears.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...all as a direct result of land clearing to establish...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Tất cả là 'kết quả trực tiếp của' (a direct result of) việc phát quang.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An outcome caused immediately and clearly by a specific action, with no other main causes.

phase3Production.content: The company's failure was a direct result of poor management.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...a direct result of land clearing to establish oil tree monoculture...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The process of removing trees, bushes, and other vegetation from an area of land.

phase3Production.content: Land clearing for agriculture is a major threat to the Amazon rainforest.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...establish oil tree monoculture on an industrial scale...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The agricultural practice of growing only one type of crop (e.g., oil palms) in a large area.

phase3Production.content: Monoculture makes crops more vulnerable to disease and pests.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...monoculture on an industrial scale, particularly in Malaysia...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Trên 'quy mô công nghiệp' (on an industrial scale).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: In a way that is very large in size, amount, or extent; relating to large-scale manufacturing or production.

phase3Production.content: The company is now producing plastic bottles on an industrial scale.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...rhinos, elephants, tigers, and numerous other fauna – have suffered...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Many other different types of animals (used in a scientific context).

phase3Production.content: The park is home to deer, bears, and numerous other fauna.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...have suffered from the unstoppable spread of oil palm plantations.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đã 'suffered from' (phải chịu đựng/bị ảnh hưởng xấu từ) sự lan rộng.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To experience or be badly affected by something bad (e.g., a disease, a bad situation).

phase3Production.content: The coastal town suffered from a massive hurricane last year.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the unstoppable spread of oil palm plantations.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự 'spread' (lan rộng) 'unstoppable' (không thể ngăn cản được).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A rapid increase or expansion that cannot be prevented or stopped.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự lan rộng/phát tán không thể ngăn cản.

phase3Production.content: The new technology's unstoppable spread has changed the industry completely.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: 'Palm oil is surely one of the greatest threats to global biodiversity,' declares Dr Farnon...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một trong những 'mối đe dọa' (threats) 'lớn nhất' (greatest) 'đối với' (to) 'đa dạng sinh học toàn cầu' (global biodiversity).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Serious dangers to the variety of all plant and animal life in the world.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các mối đe dọa đối với đa dạng sinh học toàn cầu.

phase3Production.content: Climate change is one of the biggest threats to global biodiversity today.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...' declares Dr Farnon Ellwood...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To announce something clearly, firmly, publicly, or officially.

phase3Production.content: The government declares a state of emergency.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: 'Palm oil is replacing rainforest, and rainforest is where all the species are.'

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To take the place of the natural jungle/forest (e.g., clearing the forest to plant palm oil).

phase3Production.content: New skyscrapers are replacing old, historic buildings in the city center.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: 'This has led to some radical questions among environmentalists...'

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: People who are concerned with or advocate for the protection of the environment.

phase3Production.content: Environmentalists are protesting the construction of the new factory.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...whether consumers should try to boycott palm oil entirely.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Liệu người tiêu dùng có nên 'tẩy chay' (boycott) dầu cọ.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To refuse to buy, use, or participate in something as a form of protest.

phase3Production.content: Many people are calling for a boycott of products that are tested on animals.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...boycott palm oil entirely.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Completely; in every way.

phase3Production.content: I am not entirely sure that is the right answer.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: It makes for a more dramatic story
lexicalItems.sourceContext: 'It makes for a more dramatic story, and it's very intuitive.'

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Nó tạo nên một câu chuyện kịch tính hơn' (It makes for...).

phase2Annotation.phonetic: /ɪt meɪks fər ə mɔː drəˈmætɪk ˈstɔːri/
phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An idiom meaning 'it helps to create' or 'it results in' a more exciting or emotional narrative.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Nó tạo nên/góp phần tạo nên một câu chuyện kịch tính hơn.

phase3Production.content: Having a clear villain in the movie makes for a more dramatic story.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and it's very intuitive.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Rất 'intuitive' (trực quan, dễ hiểu theo trực giác).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Easy to understand or operate based on feelings or instinct, without needing conscious reasoning.

phase3Production.content: The new software has a very intuitive design, so it's easy to learn.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: But given the complexity of the argument, I think...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An idiom meaning 'taking into account' or 'considering' how complicated something is.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Xét đến/tính đến sự phức tạp của.

phase3Production.content: Given the complexity of the case, it will likely take months to solve.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...a much more nuanced story is closer to the truth.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'story' (câu chuyện, cách nhìn) 'nuanced' (nhiều sắc thái) hơn.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An explanation or viewpoint that includes small but important details, distinctions, and subtleties (not just black and white).
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một câu chuyện/cách nhìn nhiều sắc thái hơn.

phase3Production.content: His analysis of the situation was very nuanced and considered all sides.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: One response to the boycott movement has been the argument...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A widespread, organized campaign in which people refuse to buy or use a particular product as a form of protest.

phase3Production.content: The boycott movement against the company grew quickly on social media.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the argument for the vital role palm oil plays in...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An extremely important or necessary function or purpose.

phase3Production.content: Bees play a vital role in pollinating crops.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...in lifting many millions of people in the developing world out of poverty.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Helping a large number of people to escape the state of being extremely poor.

phase3Production.content: Access to education is a key factor in lifting people out of poverty.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...people in the developing world out of poverty.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Countries with less developed industrial bases and a lower Human Development Index (HDI) compared to other countries.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thế giới đang phát triển, các nước đang phát triển.

phase3Production.content: Many diseases that are rare in the developed world are still common in the developing world.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...eliminated from the global supply chain, given how many...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The worldwide system of organizations, people, activities, information, and resources involved in moving a product from supplier to customer.

phase3Production.content: The pandemic caused major disruptions to the global supply chain.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...depend on it for their livelihoods?

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Phụ thuộc vào nó cho 'sinh kế' (livelihoods) (cách kiếm sống) của họ.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The means of securing the necessities of life (money, food, shelter).

phase3Production.content: For many farmers, their crops are their only livelihood.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: How best to strike a utilitarian balance between these competing factors...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To find a compromise between different needs/factors that provides the greatest good for the greatest number of people.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đạt được sự cân bằng vị lợi (vì lợi ích số đông).
relatedCollocates: strike a balance (between A and B)

phase3Production.content: The government is trying to strike a utilitarian balance between economic growth and environmental protection.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...between these competing factors has become a serious bone of contention.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Elements or influences that are in opposition or conflict with each other.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các yếu tố cạnh tranh/mâu thuẫn/đối chọi.

phase3Production.content: When buying a car, price and safety are often competing factors.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...has become a serious bone of contention.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'vấn đề' (bone) 'gây tranh cãi' (of contention) 'nghiêm trọng' (serious).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An idiom for a subject or issue over which there is serious disagreement.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Vấn đề/chủ đề gây tranh cãi nghiêm trọng.

phase3Production.content: The new highway proposal has become a serious bone of contention among local residents.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Even the deforestation argument isn't as straightforward as it seems.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Không 'đơn giản', 'rõ ràng' (straightforward) như vẻ ngoài.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Easy to understand; not complicated; clear.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đơn giản, rõ ràng, dễ hiểu.

phase3Production.content: The instructions were straightforward and easy to follow.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...produce at least four and potentially up to ten times more oil per hectare than...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The amount of oil produced for every 10,000 square meters of land.

phase3Production.content: This new crop variety produces significantly more oil per hectare.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...than soybean, rapeseed, sunflower or other competing oils.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A bright-yellow flowering plant from which oil (canola oil) is obtained.

phase3Production.content: Fields of yellow rapeseed are a common sight in the spring.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: That immensely high yield... is also an ecological benefit.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A very, very large amount of product (oil) produced from a specific area of land.

phase3Production.content: Thanks to new irrigation, the farm achieved an immensely high yield this year.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...what makes it so profitable – is predominantly also an ecological benefit.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Chủ yếu' (predominantly) cũng là một lợi ích sinh thái.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Mainly; for the most part; mostly.

phase3Production.content: The audience was predominantly female.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...is predominantly also an ecological benefit.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Good for or helpful to the environment and the relationships between living organisms.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Có lợi về mặt sinh thái.

phase3Production.content: Using natural predators to control pests is an ecologically beneficial farming method.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...be cleared from a patch of land than any competing oil...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A small area of land.

phase3Production.content: He grows vegetables in a small patch of land behind his house.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: As for the question of carbon emissions, the issue really depends on...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Gases (especially CO2) released into the air from burning fossil fuels or other activities, contributing to climate change.

phase3Production.content: The government has pledged to reduce carbon emissions by 20%.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...native to the degree to which they sequester carbon...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To capture and store atmospheric carbon dioxide.

phase3Production.content: Forests are crucial because they sequester carbon from the atmosphere.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...if you're cutting down virgin forest it's terrible...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Rừng nguyên sinh' (virgin forest) (rừng chưa bị con người tác động).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A forest that is in its original, untouched, pristine condition; one that has not been logged or cleared by humans.

phase3Production.content: It is rare to find large areas of virgin forest left in Europe.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...it's been allowed to get out of hand. But if it's replacing...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Bị 'vượt ra khỏi tầm kiểm soát' (get out of hand).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An idiom meaning to become difficult or impossible to control.

phase3Production.content: The party started quietly, but it soon got out of hand.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The industry is now regulated by a group called...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Ngành công nghiệp này giờ được 'quy định/quản lý' (regulated) bởi...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be controlled or managed by rules, laws, or an official body.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Được quản lý, được quy định.

phase3Production.content: The banking industry is heavily regulated by the government.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...(RSPO), consisting of palm growers, retailers...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Bao gồm' (consisting of) người trồng cọ, nhà bán lẻ...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Being composed or made up of.

phase3Production.content: The committee consists of ten members from different departments.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...palm growers, retailers, product manufacturers...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A person or business that sells goods directly to the public/consumers.

phase3Production.content: Major retailers like Walmart and Target have huge negotiating power.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and other interested parties.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các 'bên quan tâm' / 'bên liên quan' (interested parties).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: People or groups who have a connection, stake, or involvement in a particular situation or business.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các bên liên quan, các bên quan tâm.

phase3Production.content: A meeting was held with all interested parties to discuss the new project.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...an agreement has gradually been reached that standards...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'thỏa thuận' (agreement) 'đã dần dần đạt được' (has gradually been reached).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A shared understanding or consensus has been achieved slowly over time.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thỏa thuận đã dần đạt được.

phase3Production.content: After weeks of negotiation, an agreement has gradually been reached.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to meet in order for their product to be regarded as 'sustainable'.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be considered or thought of in a particular way.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Được coi là, được xem là.

phase3Production.content: He is widely regarded as one of the best writers of his generation.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The RSPO insists upon no virgin forest clearing...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Nhấn mạnh/yêu cầu' (insists upon) 'không' (no) phá rừng nguyên sinh.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To demand something forcefully, not accepting refusal.

phase3Production.content: The manager insists upon high standards of customer service.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...no virgin forest clearing, transparency and regular assessment...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The quality of being easy to perceive or understand; (in business) honesty and openness.

phase3Production.content: There are calls for greater transparency in the government's decision-making process.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...transparency and regular assessment of carbon stocks...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The act of judging or evaluating something at frequent, evenly-spaced intervals.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự/việc đánh giá thường xuyên/định kỳ.

phase3Production.content: Regular assessment of student progress is essential for effective teaching.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...regular assessment of carbon stocks, among other criteria.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The amount of carbon stored in an ecosystem (e.g., in trees, soil).

phase3Production.content: Old-growth forests hold massive carbon stocks.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...of carbon stocks, among other criteria.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Trong số các tiêu chí khác' (among other criteria).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: As one of several standards or principles used for judging something (and there are more not mentioned).
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trong số các tiêu chí khác.

phase3Production.content: Applicants were judged on their experience and qualifications, among other criteria.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Only once these requirements are fully satisfied is the oil allowed...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Chỉ khi các 'yêu cầu' (requirements) này được 'thỏa mãn' (satisfied) 'hoàn toàn' (fully).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Completely met or fulfilled (referring to conditions or requirements).
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Được thỏa mãn/đáp ứng đầy đủ.

phase3Production.content: The loan will not be approved until all conditions are fully satisfied.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...be sold as certified sustainable palm oil (CSPO).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Palm oil that has been officially recognized (certified) as being produced in an environmentally and socially responsible way.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Dầu cọ bền vững được chứng nhận.

phase3Production.content: Many major brands have committed to using only certified sustainable palm oil.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Recent figures show that the RSPO now certifies around 12 million tonnes...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: RSPO hiện 'chứng nhận' (certifies) khoảng 12 triệu tấn.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To officially state or confirm that something meets a certain standard.

phase3Production.content: This organization certifies that all our products are organic.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...12 million tonnes of palm oil annually, equivalent to...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Once every year; yearly.

phase3Production.content: The festival is held annually in the spring.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...annually, equivalent to roughly 21 percent of...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Equal in value, amount, function, or meaning.

phase3Production.content: His qualifications are equivalent to a master's degree.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...not need to be such sterile monocultures, or 'green deserts'...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các khu 'độc canh' (monocultures) 'cằn cỗi/trơ trụi' (sterile) (không có sự sống khác).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Large areas growing only one crop that are empty of other life; lacking biodiversity.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Nền độc canh trơ trụi/thiếu sự sống.

phase3Production.content: The vast cornfields created sterile monocultures, empty of wildlife.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...Ellwood's lab hints at one plant which might make all the difference.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Phòng thí nghiệm 'gợi ý về' (hints at) một loài thực vật.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To suggest or show something in an indirect way.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Gợi ý, hé lộ (một cách gián tiếp).

phase3Production.content: His smile hinted at a secret he wasn't sharing.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...grows on trees in an epiphytic fashion...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: In a way that relates to being an epiphyte, a plant that grows harmlessly on another plant (like a tree).

phase3Production.content: Orchids often grow in an epiphytic fashion on the branches of large trees.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...dependent on the tree only for support, not for nutrients...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Substances that plants, animals, or people need to live and grow.

phase3Production.content: The soil in this area is poor in nutrients, so it's hard to grow vegetables.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and is native to many tropical regions, where...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Originating from or belonging naturally to a particular place.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bản địa, có nguồn gốc từ (một vùng).

phase3Production.content: The kangaroo is native to Australia.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...where it performs a vital ecological role as a keystone species.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'loài chủ chốt' (keystone species) (loài quan trọng cho hệ sinh thái).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A species on which other species in an ecosystem largely depend, such that if it were removed the ecosystem would change drastically.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Loài chủ chốt, loài then chốt.

phase3Production.content: Beavers are a keystone species because their dams create wetlands for many other animals.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...performs a vital ecological role as a keystone species.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Thực hiện (performs) một 'vai trò' (role) 'sinh thái' (ecological) 'sống còn' (vital).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An extremely important function within the natural environment.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Vai trò sinh thái sống còn/thiết yếu.

phase3Production.content: Decomposers perform a vital ecological role by recycling nutrients in the soil.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Ellwood believes that reintroducing the bird's nest fern into...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Tái du nhập' (reintroducing) (mang trở lại) loài ráng ổ phụng.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To bring a species of animal or plant back into an area where it used to live (literally 'introduce again').
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Tái du nhập, đưa trở lại.

phase3Production.content: There is a plan for reintroducing wolves into the national park.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...allow these areas to recover their biodiversity, providing...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Cho phép các khu vực này 'phục hồi' (recover) 'đa dạng sinh học' (biodiversity) của chúng.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To return to a healthy state regarding the variety of plant and animal life.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Phục hồi đa dạng sinh học.

phase3Production.content: It will take decades for the forest to recover its biodiversity after the fire.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...providing a home for all manner of species, from fungi...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Cung cấp nhà cho 'tất cả các loại' (all manner of) loài.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An idiom meaning 'all types of' or 'all kinds of' species.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đủ loại/tất cả các loại loài.

phase3Production.content: The market sells all manner of fruits and vegetables.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to invertebrates such as insects, amphibians, reptiles...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Động vật không xương sống' (invertebrates) như côn trùng.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Animals that do not have a backbone (e.g., insects, worms, spiders).

phase3Production.content: Over 90% of animal species on Earth are invertebrates.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...such as insects, amphibians, reptiles, and even mammals.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Cold-blooded animals (like frogs) that live both on land and in water.

phase3Production.content: Frogs and salamanders are common amphibians found near ponds.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...insects, amphibians, reptiles, and even mammals.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Động vật 'bò sát' (reptiles) (ví dụ: rắn, thằn lằn).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Cold-blooded animals (like snakes or lizards) that have skin covered with scales and lay eggs.

phase3Production.content: Lizards, snakes, and crocodiles are all reptiles.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Q14 (Matching Headings): examples of a range of potential environmental advantages of oil palm tree cultivation

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Focus: Compares 'environmental advantages' with 'ecological benefit' and 'sequester carbon'.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trọng tâm: So sánh 'environmental advantages' (lợi thế môi trường) với 'ecological benefit' (lợi ích sinh thái) và 'sequester carbon' (hấp thụ carbon).

phase3Production.content:
Question: 'potential environmental advantages' 
<->
Passage: 'ecologically beneficial', 'sequesters more carbon'

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Q15 (Matching Headings): description of an organisation which controls the environmental impact of palm oil production

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một tổ chức 'kiểm soát' (controls) 'tác động môi trường' (environmental impact).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Focus: Compares 'controls the environmental impact' with 'regulated by', 'insists upon standards', 'certified sustainable'.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trọng tâm: So sánh 'controls the environmental impact' (kiểm soát tác động môi trường) với 'regulated by' (được quản lý bởi), 'insists upon standards' (yêu cầu các tiêu chuẩn), 'certified sustainable' (được chứng nhận bền vững).

phase3Production.content:
Question: 'organisation which controls the environmental impact' 
<->
Passage: 'regulated by a group called the Roundtable on Sustainable Palm Oil (RSPO)', 'insists upon...', 'certifies'

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Q16 (Matching Headings): examples of the widespread global use of palm oil

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Focus: Compares 'widespread global use' with 'most consumed... in the world', 'almost certainly in...'.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trọng tâm: So sánh 'widespread global use' (sử dụng rộng rãi toàn cầu) với 'most consumed... in the world' (được tiêu thụ nhiều nhất thế giới), 'almost certainly in...' (gần như chắc chắn có trong...).

phase3Production.content:
Question: 'widespread global use' 
<->
Passage: 'most consumed vegetable oil in the world', 'almost certainly in the soap... sandwich... biscuits'

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Q17 (Matching Headings): reference to a particular species which could benefit the ecosystem of oil palm plantations

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một loài có thể 'mang lại lợi ích cho' (benefit) 'hệ sinh thái' (ecosystem).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Focus: Compares 'benefit the ecosystem' with 'recover their biodiversity', 'providing a home for... species'.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trọng tâm: So sánh 'benefit the ecosystem' (có lợi cho hệ sinh thái) với 'recover their biodiversity' (phục hồi đa dạng sinh học), 'providing a home for... species' (cung cấp nơi ở cho... loài).
relatedCollocates: providing a home for all manner of species (synonym)

phase3Production.content:
Question: 'benefit the ecosystem' 
<->
Passage: 'allow these areas to recover their biodiversity, providing a home for all manner of species'

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Q18 (Matching Headings): figures illustrating the rapid expansion of the palm oil industry

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các 'số liệu' (figures) 'minh họa' (illustrating) 'sự mở rộng nhanh chóng' (rapid expansion).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Focus: Compares 'figures illustrating the rapid expansion' with specific statistics of growth.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trọng tâm: So sánh 'figures illustrating the rapid expansion' (số liệu minh họa sự mở rộng nhanh chóng) với các số liệu thống kê cụ thể về sự tăng trưởng.
relatedCollocates: from... 2 million tonnes... to 60 million tonnes
a figure looking likely to double or even triple

phase3Production.content:
Question: 'figures illustrating the rapid expansion' 
<->
Passage: 'grew from 6 to 17 million hectares', 'From... 2 million tonnes... to around 60 million tonnes', 'a figure looking likely to double or even triple'

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Q19 (Matching Headings): an economic justification for not opposing the palm oil industry

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'lý lẽ/biện minh' (justification) 'về kinh tế' (economic) cho việc không phản đối.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Focus: Compares 'economic justification' with arguments about poverty reduction and livelihoods.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trọng tâm: So sánh 'economic justification' (biện minh kinh tế) với các lập luận về giảm nghèo và sinh kế.
relatedCollocates: vital role... lifting... people out of poverty
low-income countries depend on it for their livelihoods

phase3Production.content:
Question: 'economic justification for not opposing' 
<->
Passage: 'argument for the vital role... in lifting... people... out of poverty', 'how many low-income countries depend on it for their livelihoods'

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Q20 (Matching Headings): examples of creatures badly affected by the establishment of oil palm plantations

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các 'sinh vật' (creatures) 'bị ảnh hưởng nặng nề' (badly affected).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Focus: Compares 'creatures badly affected' with specific examples of animals that 'have suffered'.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trọng tâm: So sánh 'creatures badly affected' (sinh vật bị ảnh hưởng nặng) với các ví dụ cụ thể về động vật 'have suffered' (đã phải chịu đựng).

phase3Production.content:
Question: 'creatures badly affected' 
<->
Passage: 'Endangered species – most famously the Sumatran orangutan, but also rhinos, elephants, tigers, and numerous other fauna – have suffered'

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Q21/22 (Multiple Choice - RSPO): B It demands that certified producers be open and honest about their practices.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Yêu cầu nhà sản xuất được chứng nhận phải 'cởi mở và trung thực' (open and honest).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Focus: Compares 'open and honest' with 'transparency'.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trọng tâm: So sánh 'open and honest' (cởi mở và trung thực) với 'transparency' (tính minh bạch).

phase3Production.content:
Question: 'be open and honest' 
<->
Passage: 'insists upon... transparency'

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Q21/22 (Multiple Choice - RSPO): C It took several years to establish its set of criteria for sustainable palm oil certification.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Mất vài năm để 'thiết lập bộ tiêu chí' (establish its set of criteria).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Focus: Compares 'took several years to establish its set of criteria' with 'Over the past decade or so, an agreement has gradually been reached'.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trọng tâm: So sánh 'took several years to establish its set of criteria' (mất vài năm để thiết lập bộ tiêu chí) với 'Over the past decade or so, an agreement has gradually been reached' (Trong khoảng một thập kỷ qua, một thỏa thuận đã dần đạt được).
relatedCollocates: Over the past decade or so (timeframe)

phase3Production.content:
Question: 'took several years to establish its set of criteria' 
<->
Passage: 'Over the past decade or so, an agreement has gradually been reached that standards...'

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Q23 (Sentence Completion): One advantage... is that it stays ....... even when not refrigerated. (Answer: solid)

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Giữ trạng thái ... ngay cả khi không được làm lạnh.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Focus: Compares 'stays... even when not refrigerated' with 'remaining solid at room temperature'.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trọng tâm: So sánh 'stays... even when not refrigerated' (giữ trạng thái... ngay cả khi không làm lạnh) với 'remaining solid at room temperature' (giữ thể rắn ở nhiệt độ phòng).

phase3Production.content:
Question: 'stays... even when not refrigerated' 
<->
Passage: 'remaining solid at room temperature'

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: best known of the animals suffering habitat loss
lexicalItems.sourceContext: Q24 (Sentence Completion): The ....... is the best known of the animals suffering habitat loss as a result of the spread of oil palm plantations. (Answer: orangutan)

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Loài 'nổi tiếng nhất' (best known) trong số các động vật 'chịu cảnh mất môi trường sống' (suffering habitat loss).

phase2Annotation.phonetic: /best nəʊn əv ði ˈænɪmlz ˈsʌfərɪŋ ˈhæbɪtæt lɒs/
phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Focus: Compares 'best known... suffering habitat loss' with 'Endangered species – most famously the Sumatran orangutan... have suffered'.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trọng tâm: So sánh 'best known... suffering habitat loss' (nổi tiếng nhất... chịu mất môi trường sống) với 'Endangered species – most famously the Sumatran orangutan... have suffered' (Các loài nguy cấp - nổi tiếng nhất là đười ươi Sumatra... đã phải chịu đựng).

phase3Production.content:
Question: 'best known of the animals suffering habitat loss' 
<->
Passage: 'most famously the Sumatran orangutan... have suffered from... habitat destruction'

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Q25 (Sentence Completion): ...the RSPO insists that growers check ....... on a routine basis. (Answer: carbon stocks)

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Kiểm tra ... 'một cách thường xuyên/định kỳ' (on a routine basis).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Focus: Compares 'check... on a routine basis' with 'regular assessment of...'.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trọng tâm: So sánh 'check... on a routine basis' (kiểm tra... thường xuyên) với 'regular assessment of...' (đánh giá thường xuyên về...).
relatedCollocates: regular assessment (synonym for check on routine basis)

phase3Production.content:
Question: 'check... on a routine basis' 
<->
Passage: 'insists upon... regular assessment of carbon stocks'

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: restore ....... in areas where oil palm trees are grown
lexicalItems.sourceContext: Q26 (Sentence Completion): Ellwood... looking into whether the bird's nest fern could restore ....... in areas where oil palm trees are grown. (Answer: biodiversity)

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Phục hồi' (restore) ... tại các khu vực trồng cọ dầu.

phase2Annotation.phonetic: /rɪˈstɔːr ɪn ˈeəriəz weər ɔɪl pɑːm triːz ə ɡrəʊn/
phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Focus: Compares 'restore...' with 'recover their biodiversity'.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trọng tâm: So sánh 'restore...' (phục hồi...) với 'recover their biodiversity' (phục hồi đa dạng sinh học của chúng).
relatedCollocates: reintroducing... could potentially allow these areas to recover their biodiversity

phase3Production.content:
Question: 'restore...' 
<->
Passage: 'reintroducing... allow these areas to recover their biodiversity'
